abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Energy Efficiency
            (EE) Project is to support a large increase in energy
            investments in Bulgaria, through the development of a
            self-sustaining, market-based financing mechanism. The
            project is focused on the development and implementation of
            financially profitable EE projects, which can provide
            sustainable and increasing reductions in greenhouse gas
            (GHG) emissions, without relying on public subsidies. In
            compliance with the country's environmental
            legislation, and Bank's operational directives,
            institutional arrangements and processes will follow
            environmental management practices on proposed subprojects,
            which entails a screening criteria based on questionnaires,
            to identify the respective environmental categories.
            Exceptions or disputed cases entail two situations: 1) if
            the Bank disagrees with the Bulgarian authorities to exclude
            a subproject from the process of an environmental impact
            assessment, disagreements will be communicated, and the Bank
            may require the procedure for environmental assessment
            category B to be applied, in which case an environmental
            management plan will be prepared in collaboration with the
            developer/investor; and, 2) subprojects that influence
            natural habitats, cultural property, or other aspects in
            conflict with the Bank's safeguards, then the greater
            protection offered by Bank policies to such resources will
            govern, and the Bank may require mitigation measures to
            comply with its procedures. Mitigation measures include:
            international standard environmental practices for crude oil
            refineries, wastes disposal from oil spills, and/or
            lubricants; appropriate installations for heat power plants
            and other combustion plants, as well as for processing
            exposed nuclear fuels; adequate installations for the
            production of cast iron and steel, as well as processing
            installations in ferrous metal foundries; likewise, adequacy
            installations concerning non-ferrous crude metals from ores,
            for surface treatment of metals, and plastics, for
            extraction and processing of asbestos containing products,
            and, for integral chemical industrial production, including
            cellulose, cement, glass, mineral substances, ceramic, and
            raw hides production; moreover, slaughter houses and farms
            for intensive breeding shall comply with standard
            regulations; hazardous wastes will be disposed of at
            selected sites, or incinerated, or undergo chemical
            treatments as needed; and, extraction of ground waters will
            be in accordance with local regulations, following waste
            water treatment practices.
